      • store

        public void store​(DrawnDisplayElementRec rec)
        Description copied from class: Annotation
        Attempts to store this annotation into the given block. Annotations that support this feature must override this method to save the additional properties available in the annotation.

        Parameters:

      • storeState

        public void storeState​(java.util.Hashtable state)
        Store the state of the bean to permit undo. NOTE: If the component storing its state needs a deep copy that it's clone() method does not provide, it must override storeState to find that functionality elsewhere.
        Specified by:
        storeState in interface javax.swing.undo.StateEditable
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • popupEditor

        public void popupEditor()
        Description copied from class: Annotation
        This is used for Annotations to generate their editing dialogs. Since these are not components, they cannot use the Component View editor. This should handle creating the undo object and saving the current state before implementing changes
        Specified by:
        popupEditor in class Annotation

      • isPropertyActive

        public boolean isPropertyActive​(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Description copied from interface: PropertyController
        Returns false if this object has a property with the given name that is considered inactive; otherwise true.

        The active active state of a property is separate from its enabled state to allow for optional properties that are actually a boolean paired with a property (i.e. value) of another type.

        Specified by:
        isPropertyActive in interface PropertyController
        Overrides:
        isPropertyActive in class Annotation
        Parameters:
        propertyName - a String containing the name of the property to check
        Returns:
        false if the property is inactive, true otherwise
        See Also:
        OptionalPropertyEditor
